entries.femaleVariant: [Slot in shard] Thanks.
This valley leads to the site.
Are there drones there, early detection systems... anything?
It's not Fort Knox, and yet... Night Corp is using Militech for security, so you never know. I guarantee you they're patrolling the area.
Construction site's walled in. Our Panzer's gun big enough for that gate?
Get that drill up and running and the road to the cellars of Arasaka Tower will be wide open.
And while we're drilling in? Should we expect anyone to crash our party?
The plan is simple.
Last but not least – intel from our recon drone has showed us a couple of weak points.
Maybe he turned up something new.
Thanks.
Get any sleep at all?
Besides, I wouldn't've slept a wink before a raid like this.
Well, that about does it. V, you ready?
That will be a job for Bob and his jammer. We'll just have to get close to their comms antenna and start transmitting.
Enter Mitch and Carol.
Sounds good so far. What else?
Once you're inside, you'll need to reach the SERC and get it do your bidding.
And if we're too slow?
Think I've seen enough.
[Disconnect from drone] I've seen enough.
Feel free to look around more if you want.
We still have some time left.
Looks like everyone's ready.
Do you feel that?
As ready as they can be. It's not your usual raid, a first for many. Mitch probably roused them.
The tension?
Now that is a sight I will never tire of seeing.
The only way into Mikoshi is to dig through to Arasaka Tower's underground levels.
Which means we have to hit the maglev tunnel construction site and hijack a Night Corp SERC.
It means they've realized what we're stepping into.
We had best not keep them waiting.
I just got back from doing some reconnaissance.
You'll want to see this.
Take a gander.
I doubt they'll be expecting trouble there.
Time is of the essence. We can't allow the guards to call for backup.
Let's not kid ourselves. It won't stall them for long.
Let's hope it keeps them busy just long enough.
In any case, our drones will match theirs. Teddy will be on the lookout to raise the red flag.
You bet your ass it is.
If everything goes as planned, nobody should know where we are or what we plan to do.
Let's do this.
How'll we get back?
Ready as I'll ever be.
All right, let's go before our asses freeze over.
And good intel is just better than a good night's sleep.
All the same, we'll want to move quickly.
Is everyone up to speed?
Start your engines, folks.
Saul's back. Let's go.
The older you get, the less you need.
How'll we get back from there?
The same way we'll go in. And fast, both ways.
Our people will try to hold the road while we're inside.
So, V. You ready?
You sleep at all?
From there, V, Panam and I will get to the laboratory and find a way into Mikoshi.
We have two objectives. One – get into Arasaka Tower and assist V in accessing Mikoshi.
And two – take advantage of the confusion to gather as much equipment as we can. Prizes like that will see to our cash-flow problem.
V, let's get you linked in.
OK, let's move.
[Get in]
V, get in and let's go.
Tanks full, fluids checked, topped up, gear loaded. We are prepared to go.
Apparently, we didn't manage to gather much intel. We got not idea what Militech is going to send our way.
We get one shot at this. And it has to work.
And everything else? If this goes to shit, we'll need to break camp, in a rush.
We're prepared to do that, too. And nothing is going to shit.
We will know soon, sooner than I like.
Whether it works or not, we're done here, need to leave. Did you know that?
I did, I do. But... one crisis at a time is all I can handle.
